comments.body: Since this is the same as the previous, better to just have just  one test, merging the parameters of both. And you don't need the class anymore, since there is a single test in it.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +154,158 @@        fd = io.StringIO(data.strip())
        result = list(validate_unwanted_patterns.bare_pytest_raises(fd))
        assert result == expected

comments.body: IIUC `expected` is always the same, so move to body of test instead of parametrizing

Actually ```expected``` is not always the same, One is checking that the check is detecting lines, and the other check that it also check the number of occurrences in each line.

---

For example if you have this:

```python
msg = "foo " "bar"
```

the check will output:
```
path/to/file:1 String unnecessarily split in two....
```

and for this:

```python
msg = "foo " "bar " "baz"
```

it will output:
```
path/to/file:1 String unnecessarily split in two....
path/to/file:1 String unnecessarily split in two....
```
